bioghist.p: James Bohkle (1930-1982) was an ichthyologist at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He received his Ph.D. in biological sciences from Stanford University in 1954, and then joined the Academy the same year as an assistant curator to work with Charles Chaplin on a book of Bahaman fishes. He was named chair of the department in 1960, a position he held until his death in 1982. He was also curator of the ichthyology collection (1963-1982). His research interests were the systematics and life histories of neotropical fishes and eels of the world.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of photographs and illustrations in ink and pencil of fish for articles by James Bohlke, published between 1953 and 1981. Illustrators include Mary H. Fuges, Steven P. Gigliotti, Catherine H. Robins, Janet Roemhild, and J. Schatz.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
